about_page.introduction: Introduction to the International Patients Department
about_page.introduction_description_headText:
The International Patients Unit at Shomal Hospital was established to provide healthcare services to international patients and Iranian expatriates according to international standards. With an experienced, multilingual, and professional team, we support you throughout every stage of your treatment, from initial consultation to returning to your home country.
‚Ä¢ Official license from the Ministry of Health
‚Ä¢ National accreditation, grade one
‚Ä¢ Over 12 years of experience
‚Ä¢ Multilingual team (English, Arabic, Turkish)
‚Ä¢ Full accompaniment from arrival to discharge
‚Ä¢ Cost-effective services with high quality
‚Ä¢ Special services including airport transfer, VIP rooms, interpreter and city tours, Caspian Sea beaches, Hyrcanian forests, and mountain resorts with views of Mount Damavand
about_page.introduction_description_subText:
• Official license from the Ministry of Health
  • National first-class accreditation
  • Over 12 years of experience
  • Multilingual team (English, Arabic, Turkish)
  • Comprehensive assistance from admission to discharge
  • Affordable pricing with premium healthcare quality
  • Exclusive services such as airport transfer, VIP rooms, translation, city tours, Caspian Sea beaches, Hyrcanian forests, and mountain resorts overlooking Mount Damavand
about_page.department_introduction_subtitle: Our goal is to ensure that you feel comfortable, safe, and supported throughout every step of your treatment ‚Äî from the initial consultation to your return home.

dr_jafarian.position: Hospital Director / Head of International Patients Department

form.sub_text: Please send us details about your medical condition. We will contact you as soon as possible.

fields.services: Select one of the medical service packages

section_one.title: Receiving Optimal Health Services is a Patient Right
section_one.content:
• Provide dignified and respectful services that honor human value and cultural and religious beliefs.
  • Offer services based on honesty, fairness, courtesy, and compassion.
  • Be free from any discrimination, including ethnic, cultural, religious, disease type, or gender.
  • Be evidence-based and prioritize the best interest of the patient.
  • Ensure fair allocation of health resources and prioritize patient treatment needs.
  • Coordinate all aspects of care, including prevention, diagnosis, treatment, and rehabilitation.
  • Provide essential amenities while avoiding unnecessary pain, suffering, or restrictions.
  • Pay special attention to the rights of vulnerable groups, including children, pregnant women, elderly, psychiatric patients, prisoners, mentally and physically disabled, and unaccompanied individuals.
  • Provide services promptly while respecting patient time and considering factors such as language, age, and gender.
  • Provide urgent and emergency care regardless of cost; non-urgent care should follow established regulations.
  • If appropriate services cannot be provided in emergencies, arrange transfer to a equipped unit after essential care and explanations.
  • In end-of-life stages where the disease is irreversible and death is imminent, provide services to ensure patient comfort.

section_two.title: Information Must Be Provided to the Patient Adequately and Appropriately
section_two.content:
• Patient rights charter provisions at the time of admission.
  • Rules and foreseeable costs of the hospital, including medical and non-medical services, insurance regulations, and introduction of support systems at the time of admission.
  • Names, responsibilities, and professional rank of medical team members responsible for patient care, including doctors, nurses, and students, and their professional interactions.
  • Diagnostic and treatment methods, strengths and weaknesses of each method, potential side effects, disease diagnosis, prognosis, and all information affecting patient decision-making.
  • Access to the attending physician and main medical team members during treatment, provision of necessary training for continuity of care, and all actions with research nature.
  • Information must be provided timely and appropriately according to patient conditions, including anxiety, pain, individual characteristics such as language, education, and comprehension ability, unless delaying treatment due to this information would harm the patient, or the patient refuses information despite being aware of the right; in which case, the patient‚Äôs will should be respected, unless lack of information exposes the patient or others to new risks.
  • The patient can access all information recorded in their clinical file, obtain a copy, and request correction of any errors.

section_three.title: The Patient's Right to Choose and Make Informed Decisions Must Be Respected
section_three.content:
• Choosing the attending physician and the health service center within regulatory framework, as well as consulting a second physician as an advisor.
  • Participation or non-participation in any research, ensuring that the decision does not affect continuity or manner of receiving health services.
  • Accepting or rejecting proposed treatments after understanding potential risks; except in cases of suicide or when refusal endangers another person.
  • Patient's prior statements regarding future treatments, when capable of decision-making, should be recorded and guide medical actions in case of incapacity, following legal provisions.
  • Patient's choice and decision-making must be free, informed, and based on sufficient and comprehensive information (as described above).
  • After providing information, allow sufficient time for the patient to make informed decisions.

section_four.title: Access to an Efficient Complaint Handling System is a Patient Right
section_four.content:
• Every patient has the right to file a complaint with the relevant authorities in case of alleged violation of their rights under this charter, without affecting the quality of health services received.
  • Patients have the right to be informed about the process and outcome of their complaint.
  • Damages arising from errors by health service providers must be compensated promptly after review and verification, according to regulations.

footer.under_logo_text: The International Patients Team at Shomal Hospital consists of professional healthcare specialists, medical interpreters, and medical travel consultants who provide multilingual, 24-hour support to international patients. Our mission is to ensure that you feel comfortable, safe, and supported throughout every stage of your treatment ‚Äî from the initial consultation to your safe return home.

introduction.title: Tourism Team Introduction
introduction.head_text: The medical tourism team of Shomal Hospital, in cooperation with Raz Navaye Aseman Alborz Company, has been established to provide a safe, comfortable, and professional experience for international patients. This team is responsible for presenting the hospital‚Äôs capabilities and attracting patients from other countries. They serve as a communication bridge between the hospital and international markets.

specialties.name: Plastic, Cosmetic and Burn Surgery Subspecialist

sub_packages.title: Upper Endoscopy
sub_packages.description:
Upper endoscopy is a diagnostic and therapeutic procedure used to examine the upper gastrointestinal tract, including the esophagus and stomach. This procedure is performed using an endoscope, a flexible tube equipped with a camera at its tip.

With upper endoscopy, physicians can directly observe the esophagus, stomach, and duodenum to detect any changes or abnormalities. The procedure also allows tissue sampling (biopsy) and minimally invasive interventions for precise diagnosis.

The procedure typically lasts 5 to 15 minutes, and considering the time required for the sedative to wear off, patient recovery usually takes 30 to 60 minutes.
sub_packages.services:
• Consultation with a gastroenterology specialist
  • HD upper endoscopy of the esophagus and stomach
  • Evaluation of ulcers, inflammation, reflux, H. pylori infection, and polyps
  • Biopsy if needed
  • H. pylori testing
  • Full sedation or anesthesia
  • Report interpretation with patient language translation
  • Post-procedure care + translator + airport transfer

sub_packages.title: Full Colonoscopy
sub_packages.description:
Colonoscopy is a diagnostic procedure used to examine the colon (large intestine) and rectum. While colonoscopy may seem intimidating, understanding the procedure and its role in screening for critical conditions such as colorectal cancer helps patients make informed decisions.

The large intestine consists of:

  • Cecum (the first part of the colon, where the appendix is located)
  • Colon (the largest section of the large intestine including ascending, transverse, descending, and sigmoid colon)
  • Rectum (the final part of the large intestine, serving as a stool storage site)

The colon plays a key role in absorbing water and electrolytes, forming stool, and eliminating waste. Colonoscopy allows detection of abnormalities such as inflammation, polyps, or tumors.

The procedure usually takes 20 to 45 minutes, and due to sedation, patient recovery typically ranges from 30 to 60 minutes.
sub_packages.services:
• Specialist consultation with a gastroenterologist
  • Pre-procedure bowel cleansing guidance
  • Comprehensive colonoscopy of the colon and rectum
  • Full sedation or anesthesia
  • Polyp removal / biopsy if necessary
  • Detailed report with images + treatment recommendations
  • Simultaneous translator, airport transfer, and post-procedure care
sub_packages.price:
450 ‚Äì 800 USD

(Polyp removal or biopsy may incur additional costs)

sub_packages.title: Uterine or Cervical Cancer Surgery
sub_packages.description:
Hysterectomy is a surgical procedure used to treat early-stage cervical cancer. During this procedure, the uterus and cervix are removed. After surgery, menstrual periods cease permanently and pregnancy is no longer possible. For non-cancerous conditions, hysterectomy is usually performed only after other treatment options have failed.


Surgical Approaches & Hospital Stay:

MethodDurationHospital Stay
Open hysterectomy1.5‚Äì3 hours3‚Äì4 nights
Laparoscopic hysterectomy1‚Äì2 hours1‚Äì2 nights
Vaginal hysterectomy1‚Äì2 hours1‚Äì2 nights

Postoperative Doctor Visits:

Main FocusVisit TypeApproximate Timing
Vital signs, incision check, pain control, bowel & urinary functionDaily visit by surgeon or assistantPost-op Day 1‚Äì2
Full evaluation, ensure no bleeding or fever, home care instructionsFinal visit by main surgeonDay 2‚Äì4 before discharge
sub_packages.services:
• Specialist consultation with a gynecologic oncology subspecialist
  • Diagnostic evaluations: Ultrasound, pelvic MRI, abdominal CT, HPV test, Pap smear, biopsy
  • Blood tests and tumor markers (CA-125, HE4, etc.)
  • Removal of uterus, cervix, and if needed pelvic lymph nodes via open or laparoscopic surgery
  • General anesthesia and 3‚Äì5 nights VIP hospitalization
  • Medication, nursing care, psychological and nutritional support
  • Interpreter and airport transfer
  • Pathology report and future treatment planning (chemotherapy/radiotherapy)
sub_packages.price:
USD 3,800 ‚Äì 6,000
(Depending on cancer stage and surgical approach)

sub_packages.title: Ovarian Cancer Surgery
sub_packages.description:
This surgery involves the removal of the ovaries and fallopian tubes. If both ovaries and both fallopian tubes are removed, it is called bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy. In early-stage cases where fertility preservation is desired and only one ovary is affected, only the affected ovary and tube may be removed.

Surgery is a primary treatment for ovarian cancer, fallopian tube cancer, and primary peritoneal cancer, and helps determine the exact type and spread of the disease.

Surgery Duration & Hospital Stay

ProcedureSurgery DurationHospital Stay
Open hysterectomy1.5‚Äì3 hours3‚Äì4 nights
Laparoscopic hysterectomy1‚Äì2 hours1‚Äì2 nights
Vaginal hysterectomy1‚Äì2 hours1‚Äì2 nights

Postoperative Doctor Visits

Main FocusVisit TypeApproximate Timing
Vital signs, wound condition, pain control, bowel & urinary functionDaily visit by surgeon or assistantDay 1‚Äì2
Full evaluation, confirm no fever or abnormal bleeding, home care instructionsFinal visit by primary surgeonBefore discharge (Day 2‚Äì4)
sub_packages.services:
• Specialist consultation with a gynecologic oncology surgeon
  • Transvaginal ultrasound, CT scan, MRI, CA-125 tumor marker
  • Surgery including removal of ovarian mass, uterus, tubes, lymph nodes, and peritoneal biopsies
  • General anesthesia and 4‚Äì6 nights VIP hospitalization
  • Detailed pathology report + oncology consultation for further treatment
  • Medications, nursing care, psychological and nutritional support
  • Interpreter services and airport transfer
  • Follow-up care including chemotherapy or targeted therapy if needed
sub_packages.price:
USD 4,500 ‚Äì 7,000
(Depending on surgical extent and patient condition)

sub_packages.title: Cardiac Angiography
sub_packages.description:
Coronary angiography is a medical imaging procedure used to examine the coronary arteries that supply blood to the heart muscle. Using X-ray imaging, this procedure helps detect any narrowing or blockage within these vital vessels.

Cardiac angiography is part of a broader procedure called cardiac catheterization, in which one or more thin, flexible tubes called catheters are inserted through a small puncture in the wrist or groin and guided through the blood vessels to reach the coronary arteries.

A diagnostic angiography typically takes about 30‚Äì60 minutes and is usually performed as an outpatient procedure or with short-term hospitalization (half-day).
sub_packages.services:
• Consultation with a cardiologist (interventional cardiology specialist)
  • Pre-procedure laboratory tests (CBC, blood sugar, kidney function, coagulation, cardiac markers, viral screening)
  • Electrocardiogram (ECG) + Echocardiography
  • Diagnostic coronary angiography via femoral or radial artery
  • Post-angiography care + one-night stay in a VIP room
  • Post-angiography medication prescription
  • Professional medical interpreter (Arabic / English / Russian)
  • Round-trip airport transfer
  • CD & full medical report in the patient's language

sub_packages.title: Angioplasty + Stent Placement
sub_packages.description:
If you have coronary artery blockage, after being examined by a cardiologist, you will be referred to a cardiac surgeon for diagnosis and treatment. Most cardiac surgeons use angioplasty to diagnose and treat blocked or narrowed coronary arteries.

Angioplasty is a minimally invasive procedure that allows both diagnosis and treatment of coronary artery blockages. With advances in medical science and technology, angioplasty has evolved from diagnostic angiography. Essentially, angioplasty is a sub-procedure of angiography, enabling physicians to not only detect cardiovascular diseases but also to treat some blockages in the coronary arteries.

The hospitalization process usually includes the following steps:

1. Pre-procedure admission and preparation
  • Initial consultation and evaluation: Typically, the patient is admitted to the hospital or medical center one day before the angioplasty. During this time, the medical team conducts all necessary preparations, including laboratory tests, physical evaluation, and patient education.
  • Anesthesia: General anesthesia is usually not required; local anesthesia or mild sedation is commonly used.
2. Procedure duration (angioplasty)
  • Time frame: If angioplasty is performed due to a blocked artery, the procedure itself typically takes 1 to 3 hours. This includes inserting the catheter through an artery (usually in the groin or arm), guiding it to the heart, performing vessel dilation with a balloon, and possibly placing a stent.
3. Post-procedure care and hospital stay
  • Initial monitoring (recovery): Immediately after the procedure, the patient stays in the recovery unit or under direct supervision for a few hours to monitor vital signs and the catheter entry site (using a pressure band or specialized devices).
  • Total hospital stay: Studies indicate that long hospitalization is usually not required. In most cases, if the patient‚Äôs condition is stable and no complications occur, discharge is possible within 24 hours.
sub_packages.services:
• All services included in the angiography package
  • Placement of drug-eluting or standard stent
  • Cost of stent (1 or 2 units) + cath lab consumables
  • Cardiac monitoring + 1 to 2 nights hospitalization in VIP ward
  • Cardiac and anticoagulant medications after the procedure
  • Post-discharge care education
  • Translator, transfer, and complete written report for follow-up treatment
sub_packages.price:
Package Price: $3,200 ‚Äì $4,200 USD
(Second stent or special drug-eluting stent may incur additional cost)
sub_packages.notes:
• Drug-eluting stents from European or American brands are used with warranty.
  • Patients with multi-vessel or complex disease require a Heart Team consultation.
  • For patients with kidney failure or uncontrolled diabetes, separate protective measures are applied.
  • It is possible for a companion to stay with the patient in a hotel-style room.

sub_packages.title: Cardiac Ablation
sub_packages.description:
Cardiac ablation (also known as heart tissue burning) is an advanced therapeutic procedure used to treat heart rhythm disorders (arrhythmias). In these types of arrhythmias, certain areas of the heart tissue spontaneously generate abnormal contraction rhythms.

During cardiac ablation, a specialist creates very small lesions in the heart tissue using heat or cold energy, targeting specific areas responsible for causing the arrhythmia.

The main goal is to eliminate or block abnormal electrical signals in the heart that cause irregular heartbeat. These small lesions help block abnormal electrical pathways and prevent the heart from producing irregular or abnormal rhythms.

This minimally invasive procedure can be used for a wide range of arrhythmias, such as atrial fibrillation, atrial flutter, and various tachycardias, and often serves as a suitable alternative to long-term anti-arrhythmic medications.

Hospitalization duration after cardiac ablation

The hospital stay after cardiac ablation is usually short, but it may vary depending on the patient's condition and type of ablation:

  1. Initial hospitalization: Most patients stay one night in the hospital after cardiac ablation.
  2. Purpose of one-night stay: This period is used for careful heart monitoring (ECG), checking for possible complications (such as bleeding at the catheter site or new irregular heartbeat), and ensuring patient stability after the procedure.
  3. Discharge: If the patient is stable and no significant complications are observed, discharge usually occurs the next day (after 24 hours).

Hospital wards involved

  1. Recovery or CCU (Cardiac Care Unit): Immediately after the procedure, the patient is transferred to this ward for several hours (or sometimes a few days if minor complications occur) under close medical and nursing supervision.
  2. Cardiac surgery or Cardiac Ward: After stabilization in recovery, the patient is moved to the general cardiac ward to spend the night and prepare for discharge.

Daily patient visits after cardiac ablation

  1. Main visit by the cardiologist (Interventionist or Arrhythmia specialist): The doctor who performed the ablation usually visits once a day (or according to their schedule) to check overall condition, catheter entry site (groin or neck), initial ECG results, and make discharge decisions.
  2. Specialist follow-up visits (if necessary): If the patient has other conditions like diabetes, high blood pressure, or kidney issues, other specialists (such as endocrinologists or nephrologists) may also visit during the short hospital stay to ensure these conditions are managed.
sub_packages.services:
• All services of the EP Study package
  • RF ablation
  • Specialized single-use equipment (sheath, catheter, mapping system)
  • 1‚Äì2 nights hospitalization in VIP room
  • Post-procedure medications, monitoring, and specialized care
  • Interpreter, airport transfer, and full report
sub_packages.price:
Package Price: 3,000 ‚Äì 6,000 USD
(Depending on arrhythmia type, mapping technology, and procedure duration)

sub_packages.title: Implantation of Cardiac Devices (CRT)
sub_packages.description:
The CRT pacemaker is one of the most advanced types of heart devices, controlling the intensity and number of heartbeats by being placed in different chambers of the heart. Systolic heart failure is a common disease worldwide and a major type of heart failure.

With the use of various cardiac medications, patients‚Äô life expectancy and quality of life have improved; additionally, one of the most important tools in treating these patients is the CRT pacemaker, which can significantly and directly improve their quality of life.

In patients with systolic heart failure (e.g., after MI, high blood pressure, etc.), the heart does not contract uniformly, and parts of the ventricular myocardium start contracting with a delay. This condition is called Dyssynchrony, which appears as a wide QRS complex on ECG (QRS > 120 ms indicates dyssynchrony).

When the myocardium does not contract uniformly, the filling time decreases. Consequently, the blood ejected to the vascular bed and the ejection fraction (EF) also decrease. The CRT pacemaker, through its electrical activity, reduces this dyssynchrony, increases ventricular blood ejection, and can largely restore the heart's function to normal.

The procedure duration and hospitalization for pacemaker implantation depend on the type of pacemaker (single, dual, or triple chamber) and the patient‚Äôs condition.

Here is an overview based on standard procedures:

  1. Surgery Duration: Pacemaker implantation is usually a relatively quick procedure, typically lasting 1‚Äì3 hours. The duration varies depending on the difficulty of placing electrodes (pacemaker leads) in the heart chambers.
  2. Hospitalization and Stay Duration: Hospitalization for pacemaker implantation is usually slightly longer than for cardiac ablation.
    • Recovery/CCU: Immediately after the procedure, the patient is monitored closely for several hours to check for bleeding at the small incision site (usually under the clavicle or upper chest) and to ensure the device functions properly.
    • Cardiac Ward: After stabilization, the patient is transferred to a general cardiac ward.
    • Number of nights: Patients are usually hospitalized 1‚Äì2 nights after pacemaker implantation.
    • One night: For simple cases without complications, the patient may be discharged the next day.
    • Two nights: This additional time ensures the device works well for a longer period and that ECG changes remain stable after several hours of rest.
  3. Doctor Visits: Daily visits are provided. The cardiologist (electrophysiologist or heart specialist) checks the wound site and pacemaker function at least once per day.
sub_packages.services:
• Main device with warranty
  • Advanced operating room with fluoroscopy
  • 2‚Äì3 nights hospitalization in VIP room
  • Device programming follow-up and patient education
  • Translator, transfer, medications, and detailed report
sub_packages.notes:
• Devices are from reputable brands (Medtronic, Boston Scientific, Abbott, etc.)
  • All services are provided with a full EP team, anesthesia, nursing, and sterile equipment
  • Follow-up and device programming online after discharge are available
  • In special cases, combining multiple services with package discount is possible

sub_packages.title: Implantation of Cardiac Devices (ICD)
sub_packages.description:
The ICD (Implantable Cardioverter Defibrillator) is a small battery-operated device; when implanted in the chest, it detects abnormal heart rhythms (arrhythmias) and, if necessary, stops them. Irregular heartbeats are halted by the ICD, restoring normal heart rhythm through electrical shocks.

The implantable cardioverter defibrillator is used for patients with dangerously high heart rates or conditions like tachycardia or ventricular fibrillation. Among the two types of ICDs, conventional and subcutaneous, most patients with tachycardia undergo treatment with conventional implantable defibrillators.

It should be noted that the ICD is different from a pacemaker; a pacemaker is an implantable device that prevents dangerously slow heartbeats.

Procedure Duration

  • ICD implantation usually takes 1.5 to 3 hours.
  • In special cases (e.g., three-chamber devices or combined with dual-chamber pacemaker), it may take longer.
  • The procedure is performed under local anesthesia and sedation (not general anesthesia).

Hospitalization Steps and Units

Pre-Operation

  • The patient is usually admitted on the morning of the procedure.
  • Preparations include blood tests, ECG, blood sugar and blood pressure checks, and sometimes chest X-ray.
  • Temporary admission is done in the cardiac unit or pre-op ward.

During and Immediately After Procedure

  • After ICD implantation, the patient is transferred for a few hours to the recovery or CCU (Cardiac Care Unit).
  • Heart rhythm, wound site, and initial device function are closely monitored.

Post-Operation and Pre-Discharge

  • Once stable, the patient is moved to the general cardiac ward (Cardiac Ward).
  • If the patient's wound does not require extended observation, discharge is usually on the same day or the next day.

Hospital Stay Duration

  • Generally, 1‚Äì2 nights are sufficient.
  • If complications occur (e.g., surgical site bleeding, rhythm instability, or need for device adjustment), hospitalization may extend to 3 nights.

Attending Physicians

The primary physician monitors device function and visits the patient at least once daily during hospitalization.
sub_packages.services:
• Main device with warranty
  • Advanced operating room with fluoroscopy
  • 2 to 3 nights hospitalization in VIP room
  • Device programming follow-up and patient education
  • Interpreter, transfer, medication, and detailed report
sub_packages.notes:
• Devices are from reputable brands (Medtronic, Boston Scientific, Abbott, etc.)
  • All services are provided with a full EP team, anesthesia, nursing, and sterile equipment
  • Device follow-up and programming online after discharge are available
  • In special cases, combining multiple services with package discounts is possible

sub_packages.title: Implantation of Cardiac Devices (Pacemaker)
sub_packages.description:
The pacemaker (CRT) is a battery-operated device that helps regulate the heart's rhythm. The generator is metal-cased to prevent fluid intrusion, weighs approximately 25-50g, and is smaller than a matchbox. Most pacemakers use lithium batteries.

The system includes one, two, or three leads depending on the type: single-chamber (one lead), dual-chamber (two leads), and CRT (three leads). Leads are inserted via the left subclavian vein, and the generator is placed under the skin. CRT devices are used to treat certain types of heart failure.

Indications include: sick sinus syndrome, atrioventricular blocks, and improving contraction in heart failure patients. The battery supplies energy transmitted through the leads to stimulate heart contraction.

Procedure duration

  • Pacemaker implantation: 60-90 minutes
  • Single-chamber: 45-60 minutes
  • Dual-chamber: 75-90 minutes
  • CRT-P (three-chamber): up to 2 hours
  • Performed under local anesthesia and mild sedation

Hospitalization steps

a) Pre-procedure: admission on the morning of or night before surgery. Includes ECG, blood tests, chest X-ray, blood sugar and pressure monitoring, medication assessment. Initial ward: Cardiology Ward or Pre-Op.

b) During and immediately after procedure: transfer to recovery or CCU for a few hours. Monitoring vital signs, heart rhythm, blood pressure, and device insertion site.

c) After stabilization: transfer to Cardiac Ward after 6-12 hours, with wound care instructions and movement restrictions.

Length of stay

Clinical conditionTypical length of stay
No complications1 night
Needs further monitoring or device adjustment2 nights
Complications such as bleeding or infection3 nights or more

In most cases, discharge occurs the next day.

Attending physicians

The primary surgeon responsible for initial pacemaker programming visits daily to assess discharge readiness and heart rhythm.
sub_packages.services:
• Main device with warranty
  • Advanced operating room with fluoroscopy
  • 2 to 3 nights hospitalization in VIP room
  • Device programming follow-up and patient education
  • Translator, transfer, medication, full report
sub_packages.notes:
• Devices from reputable brands (Medtronic, Boston Scientific, Abbott, etc.)
  • All services provided with a full EP team, anesthesia, nursing, and sterile equipment
  • Possibility to follow up and adjust the device online after discharge
  • In special cases, combining multiple services with package discounts is available

sub_packages.title: CABG (Coronary Artery Bypass Grafting)
sub_packages.description:
Open Heart Surgery is a procedure in which the chest is opened to give the surgeon direct access to the heart. The most common type is Coronary Artery Bypass Grafting (CABG), performed to improve blood flow to the heart muscle. A Heart-Lung Machine is used to temporarily take over blood circulation so the surgeon can operate safely.

Benefits of Open Heart Surgery:

  • Restores normal blood flow to the heart and prevents heart attacks
  • Improves physical capacity and quality of life after recovery
  • Reduces shortness of breath, chest pain, and chronic fatigue
  • Removes coronary artery blockages that cannot be treated with medication
  • Often effectively increases life expectancy

Stages and duration of surgery:

  • About 1 hour: Tests, monitoring setup, and general anesthesia (Preparation & Anesthesia)
  • About 3‚Äì4 hours: Sternum opening, bypass grafting, or valve repair (Main Surgery)
  • 1‚Äì2 hours: Transfer to ICU for specialized care (Recovery & Emergence from Anesthesia)

Total surgery time from anesthesia to end of operation is approximately 5‚Äì6 hours.

Hospital stay and required units:

  • 2‚Äì3 days: Postoperative specialized care for continuous ECG, blood pressure, and respiration (Cardiac ICU)
  • 4‚Äì5 days: Continued respiratory physiotherapy, medication management, and discharge education (Post-ICU Cardiac Ward)
  • 5‚Äì7 days: Wound check and second doctor visit (Post-discharge stay in hotel or medical lodging)

Overall hospital stay lasts 7‚Äì10 days.

Medical team:

  • Cardiothoracic Surgeon: Performs main surgery
  • Cardiac Anesthesiologist: Monitors consciousness, respiration, and circulation
  • Cardiologist: Initial diagnosis and preoperative evaluation
  • Intensive Care Specialist (ICU): Monitors patient in specialized care unit
  • Cardiac Nurses: Postoperative care, medication, and patient education
  • Respiratory & Physical Therapist: Assists with respiratory and physical rehabilitation
  • International Patient Coordinator: Coordinates communication between patient, medical team, and auxiliary services
sub_packages.services:
• Airport reception with ambulance or VIP car
  • International admission and assignment of translator (English, Arabic, Russian, Turkish, etc.)
  • Accommodation for patient companion in VIP ward or hospital-adjacent medical hotel
  • Electrocardiogram (ECG)
  • Echocardiography (Echo)
  • General and specialized blood tests
  • Chest X-ray, CT scan, or angiography if needed
  • General anesthesia and advanced monitoring (Heart-Lung Machine)
  • Surgery performed by a cardiac surgery fellowship and specialized team
  • Complete monitoring of patient vital signs during surgery
  • Modern and sterilized surgical equipment with international standards
  • ICU team presence at the end of surgery
  • Translator and 24-hour patient care
  • Discharge visit + final medical report in English

sub_packages.title: Liposuction / Lipomatic (Abdomen, Flanks, Thighs)
sub_packages.description:
Liposuction is a surgical procedure that uses suction tools to remove fat from specific areas of the body such as the abdomen, buttocks, thighs, arms, or neck. In addition, liposuction can also contour these areas during the procedure. Other names for liposuction include lipoplasty and body contouring.

Liposuction is used to remove fat from areas that have not responded to diet and exercise, including:

  • Abdomen
  • Upper arms
  • Buttocks
  • Thighs and ankles
  • Chest and back
  • Buttocks and thighs
  • Chin and neck

Duration of Liposuction Procedure: On average, the procedure takes 1 to 4 hours.

Determining Factors:

  • Number of areas treated: Each additional area adds approximately 30‚Äì60 minutes
  • Amount of fat removed: Larger volumes increase the procedure time
  • Technique (Tumescent, VASER, Laser): Newer techniques usually shorten the procedure but may increase preparation time
  • Anesthesia type (local or general): General anesthesia usually extends the overall time from start to recovery

Hospital Stay Duration:

Patient ConditionAnesthesia TypeHospital Stay
Limited area (e.g., lower abdomen or thighs)Local anesthesiaUsually same-day treatment, discharged a few hours after surgery
Multiple areas or large volume of fatGeneral anesthesia1 night for fluid monitoring and pain management
Liposuction combined with other surgery (e.g., abdominoplasty)General anesthesiaSometimes requires 2 nights stay

In general, most patients are discharged on the same day (Day Surgery) or after one night stay.

Attending Physicians: The attending physicians are the main surgeon (plastic surgeon).

Hospital Ward: Initially PACU (recovery), then plastic surgery or general ward.
sub_packages.services:
• Consultation with a plastic surgeon
  • Ultrasound and regional fat assessment
  • Liposuction using PAL or Lipomatic devices
  • Anesthesia, special compression garment, medication, post-op care
  • 1-night stay + VIP services
sub_packages.price:
USD 1,800 ‚Äì 2,800
(Depending on the number of areas)

sub_packages.title: Abdominoplasty (Tummy Tuck Surgery)
sub_packages.description:
Abdominoplasty, also known as a tummy tuck, is a cosmetic surgery procedure used to reduce and tighten the abdomen after pregnancy or weight loss. In this procedure, the surgeon removes loose muscles, fat, and excess skin. If the abdominal tissue is loose, it is sutured internally to achieve a firmer appearance.

Duration of Abdominoplasty: Generally, the procedure takes 2 to 5 hours. This duration depends on the following factors:

FactorEffect on Surgery Time
Extent of skin and fat removedThe more extensive, the longer the procedure
Concurrent liposuctionAdds approximately 30 to 90 minutes
Abdominal muscle repair (diastasis repair)Adds around 30 minutes if performed
Experience and speed of the surgical teamIn experienced centers, the average time is about 3 hours

On average, the surgery is considered to take around 3 hours.

Hospital Stay Duration:

Type of AbdominoplastyTypical Hospital Stay
Classic or full abdominoplasty1‚Äì2 nights
Mini-abdominoplasty (smaller, below the navel)6‚Äì12 hours (possible same-day discharge)
Abdominoplasty combined with liposuction or other surgery (e.g., mammaplasty)2‚Äì3 nights for drainage and fluid monitoring

In general, most patients are discharged after 1‚Äì2 nights with stable condition. Early discharge is not usually recommended due to the need to monitor drains and fluids.

Attending Physicians: The attending physicians are the main surgeon (plastic surgeon).

Hospital Ward: Initially PACU (recovery), then plastic surgery or general ward.
sub_packages.services:
• Specialist consultation + full preoperative tests
  • Surgical removal of excess abdominal skin and fat
  • Abdominal muscle shaping
  • Postoperative compression garment, medication, 2-night hospital stay
  • Nursing care and follow-up sessions

sub_packages.title: Blepharoplasty (Upper and Lower Eyelid Surgery)
sub_packages.description:
Blepharoplasty, or eyelid cosmetic surgery, helps reduce wrinkles and create a more youthful appearance by lifting the eyelids. This procedure not only restores beauty and youthfulness to the face, but also enhances the visibility of the whites of the eyes (cornea) while maintaining the natural shape of the eyes, giving the face a refreshed look.

Duration of Blepharoplasty Surgery:

Approx. DurationType of Blepharoplasty
Approx. 45 minutes to 1 hourUpper eyelid blepharoplasty
Approx. 1 to 1.5 hoursLower eyelid blepharoplasty
Approx. 1.5 to 2.5 hoursFull four-eyelid blepharoplasty

Most procedures are performed under local anesthesia with sedation. For combined surgeries (e.g., blepharoplasty with brow lift or fat removal), general anesthesia may be used.

Hospital Stay:

Duration of StayPatient StatusType of Anesthesia
Usually outpatient; discharge 2‚Äì4 hours after surgeryPatient stable and low-riskLocal anesthesia with sedation
Sometimes 1-night stay for closer monitoringHigher monitoring neededGeneral anesthesia or combined surgery (e.g., facelift)

In most cases, blepharoplasty is an outpatient procedure with same-day discharge. Overnight stay is recommended only for specific cases (advanced age, cardiac disease, diabetes, or major combined surgery).

Attending Physicians: The primary plastic surgeon.
Hospital Wards: Initially PACU, then plastic surgery or general surgical ward.
sub_packages.services:
• Specialized consultation with an eye cosmetic surgeon
  • Upper/lower eyelid surgery (simultaneous or separate)
  • Performed under local anesthesia or general anesthesia
  • Medication, absorbable or invisible sutures
  • Short stay + translator + transfer

sub_packages.title: Face and Neck Lift
sub_packages.description:
Facelift and Neck Lift is an extensive reconstructive and cosmetic surgery performed to reduce signs of aging such as skin sagging, deep wrinkles, and volume loss in the mid and lower face and neck. Due to its complexity, general anesthesia, and surgical workload, specialized hospital care is required.

Duration of Facelift and Neck Lift Surgery

The operation time depends on various factors but is generally longer than eyelid or liposuction procedures:

  • Mid-Face/Lower Face Lift: Usually 3‚Äì4 hours.
  • Full Facelift and Neck Lift: Usually 4‚Äì6 hours.
  • Combined procedures: If performed with blepharoplasty, brow lift, or fat grafting, surgery time may extend up to 7‚Äì8 hours.

Important note: This procedure is almost always performed under general anesthesia.

Hospital Stay Duration

Due to the extensive nature of the surgery, risk of low blood pressure in early hours, precise drain management, and IV pain medications, overnight hospitalization is necessary:

  • Standard stay: 1‚Äì2 nights.

Additional details:

  1. First night: The patient is immediately transferred to the recovery room post-surgery and then to the hospital ward for monitoring drains, wounds, swelling, and blood pressure.
  2. Second night (if necessary): If drain management or swelling control is not sufficient on the first night, or additional care is needed, a second night stay is recommended.
  3. Discharge: Usually occurs once vital signs are stable, pain is controlled, and patient is educated on drain care.

Attending Physicians

The surgical team involved in this specialized procedure includes:

  • Plastic Surgeon: The main operating physician responsible for planning and executing SMAS techniques, skin and muscle tightening, and postoperative protocols. Daily visits to check wounds and drains.
  • Anesthesiologist: Responsible for general anesthesia management during surgery and post-op recovery. Postoperative visits to assess breathing and potential anesthesia complications.

Hospital Departments Involved

  • Operating Room: Where the major surgery under general anesthesia takes place.
  • Recovery (PACU): Immediate post-anesthesia care (usually 2‚Äì4 hours).
  • Plastic Surgery / General Surgery Ward: Main hospital stay for 1‚Äì2 nights. In specialized hospitals, there may be a dedicated ward for plastic surgery patients.
sub_packages.services:
• Preoperative 3D design
  • Full facelift and neck lift using SMAS technique or lift threads
  • General anesthesia, nursing care, medications
  • 2-night hospitalization, dressings, facial compression garment

sub_packages.title: Breast Augmentation / Lift (With Implant)
sub_packages.description:
Common procedures for women: Breast lift and breast implants are performed to shape and enhance the breasts. Factors such as significant weight loss, breastfeeding, or medical conditions can affect breast volume and shape. Small or sagging breasts may simply be due to body structure.

Purpose of surgery: Breast implants increase size and volume, while a breast lift corrects sagging. Implants are done under general anesthesia, while a breast lift can also be performed under local anesthesia.

Surgery duration:
ConsiderationApprox. DurationType of Surgery
With general anesthesia or deep sedation1‚Äì2 hoursBreast implants (only)
Due to tissue repositioning2‚Äì3 hoursBreast lift (only)
Most extensive, usually under general anesthesia2.5‚Äì4 hoursCombination lift & implants (Augmentation-Mastopexy)

üîπ These procedures are almost always performed under general anesthesia.

Hospital stay:
ProcedureDetails
Breast implants onlyMostly outpatient; discharge 4‚Äì8 hours post-op
Breast lift or lift with implantsMostly outpatient; 1 night stay if needed for monitoring bleeding, swelling, and pain

‚úÖ In most cases, no extended hospitalization is required; discharge same day or next day.

Attending doctors:

Main doctor: Plastic Surgeon

Hospital wards: Recovery (PACU) first, then plastic surgery or general ward
sub_packages.services:
• Consultation + selection of implant type and size
  • Reputable European or American brands (Mentor, Motiva)
  • Surgery under general anesthesia
  • 1-night hospitalization, medical bra, medication, follow-up sessions
sub_packages.price:
USD 2,800 ‚Äì 3,800 for breast implants
USD 2,500 ‚Äì 3,200 for lift without implants

sub_packages.title: Hair Transplant
sub_packages.description:
Hair Transplant: A specialized surgical procedure performed by a professional surgeon. Hair follicles are taken from non-bald areas or body hair and implanted into bald areas of the scalp, promoting repair and regrowth of damaged follicles.

Procedure Duration:
MethodDurationDetails
FUE1‚Äì2 daysDay 1: Graft extraction; Day 2: Implantation in bald areas. Light transplants may be completed in one day.
FUT8‚Äì10 hoursStrip harvesting, typically one full day

üîπ Hair transplant is almost always performed under local anesthesia; general anesthesia is not used.

Hospital Stay:
TypeDetails
OutpatientZero days; brief observation in clinic post-procedure, then discharge home. Hospitalization is usually not required.
Attending Medical Team:
  • Specialist Physician (Surgeon or Dermatologist): manages clinic, plans hairline, performs extraction and implantation, post-op visits
  • Experienced Technicians: perform precise extraction and implantation under physician supervision
  • Clinic Nurse/Physician: administers local anesthesia and monitors patient status
Clinic Facilities:
  • Procedure Room: main work area with sterilization tools and microscopes
  • Recovery/Rest Area: short rest after procedure before discharge
sub_packages.services:
‚Ä¢ Hair density and donor area assessment
‚Ä¢ Hairline design
‚Ä¢ Extraction and implantation using FUE or SAFER devices
‚Ä¢ Post-operative care, medication, 6-month follow-up
‚Ä¢ 1-night stay + VIP services

sub_packages.title: Sleeve Surgery
sub_packages.description:
Sleeve Gastrectomy (Gastric Sleeve) is one of the most effective bariatric surgeries, in which approximately 75‚Äì80% of the stomach is removed, leaving only a narrow, tube-shaped portion. This procedure is performed laparoscopically (minimally invasive), meaning small incisions are made in the abdomen without large surgical cuts.

Objectives and benefits for the patient:

  • Rapid and sustained weight loss: approximately 50‚Äì70% of excess weight is lost within 6‚Äì12 months.
  • Reduced appetite: decreased secretion of the hunger hormone (ghrelin).
  • Improvement of comorbidities: type 2 diabetes, high blood pressure, cholesterol, and sleep apnea.
  • Enhanced self-confidence and physical fitness.
  • No need for foreign body implantation or intestinal bypass, reducing gastrointestinal complications compared to other surgeries.
  • Shorter recovery period compared to other bariatric procedures.

Procedure duration and stages:

  • Preparation and anesthesia: ~45 minutes ‚Äì cardiac, lung check, and medication administration.
  • Main surgery: ~1‚Äì2 hours ‚Äì laparoscopic removal of the stomach portion.
  • Recovery: ~1 hour ‚Äì awakening and transfer to recovery room.

Total surgery time: ~2‚Äì2.5 hours.

Hospital stay and recovery process:

  • Day 1: vital signs monitoring for the first 24 hours ‚Äì Post-Operative ICU or recovery.
  • Day 2‚Äì3: nutritional care and fluid intake training ‚Äì General surgery or laparoscopic ward.
  • Day 5‚Äì7: follow-up visit and dietary adjustment ‚Äì Post-discharge therapeutic stay (medical hotel or rehabilitation center).

Total hospital stay: ~3‚Äì4 days; total recommended treatment stay in Iran: ~10 days.

Medical team involved:

  • Bariatric and laparoscopic surgeon: performing the sleeve surgery.
  • Anesthesiologist: managing general anesthesia.
  • Nutrition specialist: designing pre- and post-operative diet plans.
  • Internal medicine or endocrinologist: evaluating diabetes and metabolism.
  • Clinical psychologist (if needed): preparing the patient mentally for lifestyle changes.
  • Bariatric specialized nurses: post-operative care and diet education.
sub_packages.services:
• Airport pickup (VIP car or ambulance)
  • International patient admission at the hospital
  • Dedicated translator and patient companion
  • Blood tests and liver function assessment
  • Cardiac echo and lung evaluation
  • Blood sugar and thyroid hormone tests
  • Pre-operative visits by surgeon, anesthesiologist, and nutritionist
  • Laparoscopic sleeve surgery with advanced equipment
  • Continuous monitoring until vital signs stabilize
  • Pain and anti-nausea medication
  • Light physiotherapy to prevent pulmonary embolism
  • Gradual diet (liquids, soup, soft puree)
  • Stomach check with Leak Test
  • Long-term nutrition education and supplement guidance
  • Official surgery and medication report in English
  • Follow-up visits with surgeon and nutritionist
  • Transfer to therapeutic accommodation until return

sub_packages.title: Fat Injection to Face or Body
sub_packages.description:
Fat grafting is a cosmetic procedure using a patient's own excess fat. The harvested fat is processed and re-injected into areas such as the face, breasts, or buttocks, enhancing volume and boosting confidence.

Procedure Duration:

  • Harvesting (Liposuction): 1‚Äì3 hours depending on area and volume
  • Preparation & Centrifuge: 30‚Äì60 minutes
  • Injection (Grafting): 1‚Äì3 hours depending on number of areas and precision

Total procedure time: 3‚Äì6 hours. Anesthesia: Local + sedation for small volumes; general anesthesia for large volumes.

Hospital Stay:

  • Small volumes: outpatient, discharged after a few hours
  • Large volumes (BBL or breast): 1 night stay for monitoring vital signs, pain, and swelling

‚úÖ Overall: Expect 1 night stay for extensive fat grafting; otherwise outpatient.

Attending Physicians:

  • Plastic surgeon: leads liposuction and injection, post-op checkups
  • Anesthesiologist: manages anesthesia and recovery monitoring
  • Nursing team: post-op care, pain management, assistance with mobility
sub_packages.services:
• Fat harvesting from abdomen/flanks
  • Fat purification and injection into cheeks, lips, buttocks, etc.
  • Local anesthesia, medications, and dressing
  • Short stay with VIP services
  • Simultaneous translator (Arabic / English)
  • Round-trip airport transfer
  • Accommodation in hotel or guesthouse near hospital
  • Written and digital report provided in patient‚Äôs language
  • Postoperative care and patient education

sub_packages.title: Hip Joint Replacement
sub_packages.description:
Total Hip Replacement is an orthopedic surgical procedure in which the femoral head and acetabulum are replaced with prosthetic components, typically performed via posterior (from the back) or anterior (from the front) approach.

Objectives and benefits for the patient:

  • Significant pain relief from cartilage or bone wear.
  • Improved range of motion and daily function.
  • Enhanced quality of life post-recovery.
  • Long-lasting implants (20‚Äì30 years or more).
  • Minimally invasive techniques in many cases, leading to smaller incisions and faster recovery.

Duration and stages of surgery:

  • Preparation and anesthesia: ~1 hour, including final assessments, imaging, and general or spinal anesthesia.
  • Main surgery: ~1.5‚Äì2.5 hours, accessing the joint, removing damaged tissue, and installing implants.
  • Closure and transfer: ~1 hour, awakening and moving to recovery room.

Total operative time: usually 3‚Äì4 hours.

Hospital stay and recovery:

  • 1 day: Pain and vital signs monitoring in recovery or light ICU.
  • 3‚Äì5 days: Early walking with walker/cane in general orthopedic ward.
  • 7‚Äì10 days: Focused physiotherapy and follow-up visits; post-discharge therapeutic stay.

Typical hospital stay: 4‚Äì6 days.

Medical team involved:

  • Orthopedic Surgeon: Performing surgery and implant installation.
  • Anesthesiologist: Managing anesthesia and pain (general or spinal).
  • Physical Medicine & Rehabilitation Specialist: Designing post-op physiotherapy plan.
  • Specialized Physiotherapists: Training patient in proper walking and strengthening muscles around the joint.
  • Internist/ICU Specialist: Monitoring underlying conditions and preventing embolism.
  • International Patient Coordinator: Facilitating patient communication and logistics.
sub_packages.services:
• Comprehensive preoperative consultation by surgeon and anesthesiologist
  • Controlled anesthesia and advanced postoperative pain management (PCA)
  • Initiation of walking and light exercises within 24‚Äì48 hours
  • Initial monitoring and training by physiotherapist
  • Daily visits by surgeon and orthopedic team
  • Provision of all necessary orthopedic equipment (walker, cane)
  • Transfer to rehabilitation center or luxury hotel (preferably near medical center)
  • Daily focused physiotherapy sessions to fully restore walking
  • Follow-up visits with surgeon to check wound and implant status
  • Preparation of complete medical report including implant brand and serial number in English
  • Comprehensive education on long-term care and movement restrictions
  • Airport transfer and support until departure

sub_packages.title: Knee Joint Replacement
sub_packages.description:
Total Knee Replacement (Knee Arthroplasty) is an orthopedic surgery in which the damaged surfaces of the femur and tibia, usually due to severe arthritis, rheumatism, or previous injuries, are replaced with metal and plastic implants to restore painless movement and proper range of motion.

Benefits for the patient:

  • Immediate pain relief from chronic knee pain.
  • Full recovery of range of motion: ability to bend and straighten the knee.
  • Improved quality of life: walk longer distances, climb stairs, return to normal activities.
  • Standardized procedure: one of the most successful and popular orthopedic surgeries worldwide.

Surgery duration and process:

  • Duration: 1‚Äì2 hours depending on complexity and joint deformity.

Hospital stay and required units:

  • Few hours: Recovery room under direct anesthesia monitoring.
  • 2‚Äì4 days: Pain management and early physiotherapy (walking with walker).
  • 5‚Äì7 days: Rehabilitation center or medical hotel stay.

Total patient stay: 3‚Äì5 days in hospital and approximately 10‚Äì14 days total recommended treatment stay in Iran.

Key note: Success depends directly on quality of intensive early physiotherapy.

Attending physicians and team:

  • Knee Arthroplasty Surgeon: Primary surgeon responsible for operation and initial rehabilitation plan.
  • Anesthesiologist: Manages anesthesia and postoperative pain control.
  • Orthopedic Physiotherapist: Implements daily rehabilitation program to achieve maximum knee flexion.
  • Pain Specialist: Manages advanced pain control if needed.
  • International Coordinator: Handles logistics, translation, and hotel arrangements.
sub_packages.services:
• Preoperative Tests: Complete routine and specialized tests (blood tests, ECG, radiography).
  • Specialized Anesthesia: Managed by anesthesiologist, focused on postoperative pain control (e.g., nerve blocks).
  • Knee Replacement Surgery: Performed using high-quality certified implants.
  • Medication and Pain Management: 24/7 access to pain management and analgesics.
  • Hospital Nutrition: Meal plans tailored to recovery.
  • Intensive Daily Physiotherapy: From day 1‚Äì2, mobility and range-of-motion exercises.
  • Walking Training: Proper use of walker/cane and safe movement techniques.
  • Nutrition and Diet Consultation: Guidance to accelerate bone and tissue recovery.
  • Nursing Care: Regular postoperative care by specialized orthopedic nurses.
  • Home/Hotel Care: Outpatient visits at accommodation after hospital discharge.
  • Patient Companion Education: Care tips and exercises for continuation in home country.
  • Comprehensive Medical Report: Full report including pathology results and medication instructions for referring physician.
  • Final Transfer: Escort from accommodation to international airport at departure.

sub_packages.title: Spinal Surgery (Discectomy)
sub_packages.description:
Discectomy is a surgical procedure in which the part of an intervertebral disc that is pressing on the spinal canal or nerve root (herniated) is removed to relieve pressure and alleviate symptoms such as sciatica, numbness, or weakness. It is usually performed microscopically or endoscopically to minimize invasiveness.

Main benefits:

  • Rapid pain relief: Radicular pain is often immediately or within a few days significantly reduced.
  • Recovery of nerve function: Prevents further nerve damage and gradually restores lost strength and sensation.
  • Shorter recovery time: Patients can resume daily activities sooner, especially with minimally invasive techniques.
  • Long-term effectiveness: Discectomy results are highly successful in the long term.

Timing and hospitalization details:

  • Procedure duration: 45 minutes to 1.5 hours (depending on number of discs and complexity)
  • Hospital stay: 1-2 nights (patients often discharged the next day in minimally invasive methods)
  • Ward: Orthopedic or Neurosurgery
  • Total suggested stay in Iran: 7-10 days including initial recovery and light physiotherapy sessions

Medical team and visits:

  • Neurosurgeon or spine surgeon: Primary surgeon and daily visits
  • Anesthesiologist: Assess anesthesia risk and manage patient status during surgery
  • Pain specialist: Manage post-operative pain (often with epidural or local injections)
  • Orthopedic/Neuro physiotherapist: Initial assessment and start of daily rehabilitation program
  • Visits: Pre-operative, daily during hospitalization, and post-discharge outpatient visits to monitor recovery and remove stitches
sub_packages.services:
• Pre-anesthesia examinations: Complete routine checks (blood tests, ECG, specialized spinal imaging).
  • Specialized consultation: Final visit by the surgical, anesthesia, and pain management team.
  • Discectomy surgery: Minimally invasive (microscopic or endoscopic) procedure performed by a spine surgeon.
  • Anesthesia management: General anesthesia with focus on patient safety and intraoperative pain control techniques.
  • Post-operative pain management: Active pain control using medications and, if needed, local nerve blocks by a pain specialist.
  • 24-hour nursing care: Continuous monitoring of vital signs and post-operative care.
  • Daily (intensive) physiotherapy: Starting on the first or second day post-discharge, focusing on proper body posture and core muscle strengthening.
  • Safe movement training: Instruction on proper sitting, standing, walking, and bending to prevent re-injury.
  • Therapeutic nutrition: Nutrient-rich diet for faster tissue recovery.
  • Outpatient follow-up visits: One or two visits with the surgeon after discharge to check wound and neurological status.
  • Recovery care: If needed, nursing services at the accommodation (hotel/apartment) for several days.
  • Comprehensive medical report: Detailed report including surgery details, radiology images, and medication instructions for the referring physician.
  • Return transfer: Transportation from accommodation to the airport for departure flight.

sub_packages.title: Brain Tumor Surgery
sub_packages.description:
Brain Tumor Surgery is a surgical procedure aimed at complete (Curative) or maximal (Debulking) removal of a brain tumor. Depending on the location, size, and type of tumor, the surgery may involve a craniotomy (removal of part of the skull to access the tumor). In advanced cases, minimally invasive techniques such as endoscopic surgery or navigation may be used.

Main benefits for the patient:

  • Reduction of intracranial pressure: alleviates symptoms such as severe headaches and vision or movement problems caused by tumor pressure.
  • Sampling and accurate diagnosis: allows for tissue sampling for pathology to determine tumor type (benign or malignant).
  • Improved quality of life: removal of the tumor may improve life expectancy and patient alertness.
  • Initiation of adjuvant therapies: provides opportunity to start radiotherapy or chemotherapy post-surgery.

Scheduling and hospitalization:

  • Surgery duration: 3 to 8 hours (may be longer for complex cases)
  • ICU/CCU stay: 1 to 3 days
  • Normal ward stay: 4 to 7 days
  • Total recommended stay in Iran: 14 to 21 days

Medical team:

  • Lead Surgeon: Neurosurgeon specializing in brain tumors
  • Anesthesia Team: Anesthesiologist experienced in neurosurgery
  • Special Care: ICU/CCU specialists for post-operative care
  • Complication Management: Neurologist for daily neurological monitoring
  • Rehabilitation: Physiotherapist and occupational therapist for motor and cognitive recovery
  • Coordination: International patient coordinator to liaise with the medical team
sub_packages.services:
• Admission to a private room with advanced monitoring facilities (ICU/CCU if necessary).
  • All preoperative tests and specialized imaging (e.g., advanced MRI).
  • Preoperative consultation and evaluation by an anesthesiologist.
  • Brain tumor surgery using standard or advanced techniques (e.g., neural navigation).
  • Comprehensive and specialized anesthesia management during surgery.
  • Special care and continuous monitoring in the ICU/CCU post-surgery.
  • Daily visits by the neurosurgeon.
  • Daily visits by a neurologist for neurological monitoring.
  • 24-hour pain management programs.
  • Implementation of brain edema control protocols.
  • Early specialized physiotherapy to maintain mobility.
  • Occupational therapy sessions (if needed for fine motor skills recovery).
  • Providing necessary education to the accompanying person regarding post-surgery care.
  • Preparation of the final medical report and treatment summary in English (for submission to the referring physician in the home country).
  • Provision of medications for the initial recovery period.
  • Dedicated transfer for airport return.

sub_packages.title: Septoplasty (Correction of Nasal Septum Deviation)
sub_packages.description:
Septoplasty is a surgical procedure to correct a deviated nasal septum. The septum is a wall that divides the nasal cavity into left and right sides. In many individuals, the septum may be crooked due to congenital factors or trauma, causing nasal obstruction or difficulty breathing.

Main objective of septoplasty:

  • Correcting the nasal septum deviation to improve breathing and ensure proper airflow in the nasal cavity.

Important notes:

  • Not a cosmetic procedure: This surgery is therapeutic and not related to cosmetic appearance (unlike rhinoplasty, which is aesthetic). Sometimes both procedures are performed together (septorhinoplasty).
  • Anesthesia: The procedure is usually performed under general anesthesia or deep local sedation.

Duration of septoplasty:

  • Approximate time: Typically takes 1 to 2 hours.
  • Technique: The surgeon works through small internal nasal incisions to access the septum, straighten the crooked parts, remove excess cartilage or bone, and finally stabilize the septum in place.

Hospital stay duration:

  • Most septoplasties are outpatient (Day Surgery).
  • Patients are usually discharged a few hours after the procedure once fully alert and vital signs are stable.
  • Exception: In rare cases of severe deviation, or if combined with major procedures (e.g., sinus surgery or complex rhinoplasty), a 1-night hospital stay may be recommended for additional monitoring.

Attending physicians and hospital departments:

  • ENT Specialist: Primary physician responsible for performing the surgery and post-operative visits (checking dressings, splints, and sutures).
  • Anesthesiologist: Responsible for managing anesthesia and monitoring the patient during the procedure, if general or deep sedation is used.
sub_packages.services:
• Specialist visit with ENT surgeon
  • Sinus and nasal imaging and tests
  • Septum correction surgery (internal, without changing appearance)
  • 1-night hospitalization, medication, post-op breathing training
  • Translator, airport transfer, VIP room

sub_packages.title: Adenoidectomy and/or Tonsillectomy
sub_packages.description:
Adenoids are lymphatic tissue masses located in the upper part of the throat, behind the nasal cavity (nasopharynx). They help the immune system fight infections.

Adenoidectomy is the surgical removal of this tissue.

Main reasons for the procedure:

  • Chronic airway obstruction: Enlarged adenoids (hypertrophy) leading to mouth breathing, severe snoring at night, and obstructive sleep apnea.
  • Recurrent infections: Repeated middle ear infections (otitis media) due to blockage of the Eustachian tube by swollen adenoids.

Procedure duration: Usually 30 minutes to 1 hour, performed through the mouth. General anesthesia is commonly used.

Hospital stay: Usually outpatient; the patient is discharged a few hours after surgery.

Attending physicians and involved departments:

  • ENT Specialist: main surgeon responsible for planning, performing the surgery, and post-discharge follow-ups.
  • Anesthesiologist: manages general anesthesia and immediate post-op care.
  • Preparation and operating room: where anesthesia and surgery are performed.
  • Recovery unit (PACU): monitors the patient post-surgery for bleeding control and pain management.
sub_packages.services:
• Consultation with pediatric or adult surgeon
  • Necessary preoperative tests
  • Adenoid (third tonsil) and/or tonsil surgery using coblation or traditional method
  • Short hospitalization + medication + post-op dietary guidance
sub_packages.price:
USD 1,000 ‚Äì 1,500
(Depending on patient's age and surgical method)

sub_packages.title: Nasal or Sinus Polyps (Polypectomy)
sub_packages.description:
Polypectomy refers to the surgical removal of nasal or sinus polyps. Polyps are small, non-cancerous, tear-shaped growths that develop in the lining of the nasal passages or sinuses.

Main goal:

  • Remove polyps to relieve symptoms such as chronic nasal congestion, loss of sense of smell (anosmia), and sinus pressure or pain.
  • If polyps are due to chronic sinusitis, polypectomy is often performed alongside endoscopic sinus surgery (FESS) to open sinus drainage pathways.

Procedure duration:

  • Simple polypectomy (single, small): 20 to 30 minutes
  • Polypectomy with FESS: 1.5 to 3 hours

Note: The procedure can be performed under general anesthesia or sometimes with local anesthesia combined with deep sedation.

Hospital stay:

  • Simple and limited polypectomy: Usually outpatient; the patient is discharged the same day.
  • Polypectomy with FESS: If closer monitoring or tamponade is needed, 1 night stay is recommended; in most cases, even after FESS the patient can be discharged the same day or the next morning.

Attending physicians and departments involved:

  • ENT Specialist: Directly responsible for performing the procedure and follow-ups.
  • Anesthesiologist: Manages anesthesia and immediate post-op care.
  • Preparation and operating room: Where anesthesia and surgery are performed.
  • Recovery unit (PACU): Monitors the patient post-surgery for bleeding control and pain management.
sub_packages.services:
• Consultation with an ENT specialist
  • Nasal endoscopy evaluation
  • Closed removal of nasal polyps
  • Allergy medications and nasal irrigation

sub_packages.title: Rhinoplasty (Nose Surgery)
sub_packages.description:
Rhinoplasty is a surgery performed to change the shape and size of the nose to improve appearance or correct functional breathing problems (or both).

Main goals:

  • Cosmetic: change overall nose size, reshape nasal bridge (hump), reshape nasal tip, adjust nostril size or shape, and correct asymmetry.
  • Functional: often combined with septoplasty to correct deviated septum and improve breathing. This combination is called rhinoseptoplasty.

Procedure duration: Usually 2 to 4 hours, depending on complexity. Surgeons may use internal incisions (closed) or small external incisions on the columella (open).

Hospital stay: Mostly outpatient; patient discharged after a few hours. For major structural changes or special medical conditions, 1-night stay may be recommended.

Attending physicians and involved departments:

  • Facial plastic surgeon or ENT surgeon with nasal surgery expertise: responsible for cosmetic and functional aspects.
  • Anesthesiologist: manages general anesthesia.
  • Recovery unit: initial post-op monitoring.
  • Plastic/ENT ward: if overnight stay is required.

Post-discharge, the patient should wear a nasal splint for about one week, avoid strenuous activity, and follow prescribed medications. Initial swelling and bruising are common in the first week.
sub_packages.services:
• Consultation with a plastic surgeon
  • Specialized imaging and nasal shape planning
  • Open or closed surgery (with general anesthesia)
  • 1-night hospital stay, nasal cast, post-op medications
  • Cast removal and follow-up sessions
  • Translator, airport transfer, VIP room accommodation
